author: funnygiulio
content: btw regarding EIP7783, is it fine if re-bring it up at allcoredevs once people make a more general opinion on it? for now it seems most except geth are in agreement it is a good idea to use it to increase gas limit in the short term.

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys

author: francis.li
content:
Hello allcoredevs, this is Francis from base team.

We have a RFC for `On more blobs for PectraA`: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19jZcm5CgWM12Eqg1HRwG_ppd1EL9tduheckBmoFBCNM/edit?pli=1

https://x.com/0xFrancisLi/status/1844472817406050777

In this doc, we tried to gather all the recent discussions / concerns / researches from the community and ourselves about blob increase and proposed a path forward. Feel free to comment on the doc and would love to have hear your opinions!

Thank you very much!

author: butta
content:
RE bandwidth

We (ethstaker) are seeing about 5Mb/s up & down on average on multiple setups.

author: francis.li
content: 5MB/s up = 40Mbps, on average for just upload bandwidth? Is there a graph / data you can share here?

author: butta
content:
It's 5 Megabit per second (~0.625MB/s), with spikes to 20-25Mb/s
We are preparing a blog post that we will share soon

author: francis.li
content: Cool, that makes sense in terms of average bandwidth requirement, the concern for solo stakers are mainly around worst case or maybe >p90 scenarios (especially for proposing a block where you need to gossip out all the block & blobs within 4s) and that's what the doc aims to focus on

author: butta
content: Cool, that makes sense in terms of

content:
~~Is there a place to see the distribution of staker bandwidth?~~
sorry just saw - blog post coming soon

author: pipermerriam
content: Is there any way to differentiate between syncing loads (serving snap or block sync) on these average client bandwidth numbers?  If anyone has those numbers I'd be interested in them.
